sub_topic: Interpolation and extrapolation of data using Lagrange polynomials
message_1:
Suppose you have collected the following set of data points representing the temperature readings (in Celsius) at different times during a day:

|Time (hours)|Temperature (Celsius)|
|---|---|
|1|15|
|3|18|
|5|12|
|7|10|

Using Lagrange polynomial interpolation, find the approximate temperature at 4 o'clock in the afternoon.
message_2:
To find the approximate temperature at 4 o'clock using Lagrange polynomial interpolation, we will use the given data points to create a polynomial function that passes through all the points. The general formula for the Lagrange polynomial is:

P(x) = L0(x) * f(x0) + L1(x) * f(x1) + L2(x) * f(x2) + ... + Ln(x) * f(xn)

where Lk(x) are the Lagrange basis polynomials and f(xk) are the given data points.

For our data set, we have 4 data points:

x0 = 1, f(x0) = 15
x1 = 3, f(x1) = 18
x2 = 5, f(x2) = 12
x3 = 7, f(x3) = 10

Now, we will calculate the Lagrange basis polynomials L0(x), L1(x), L2(x), and L3(x):

L0(x) = ((x - x1)(x - x2)(x - x3)) / ((x0 - x1)(x0 - x2)(x0 - x3))
L1(x) = ((x - x0)(x - x2)(x - x3)) / ((x1 - x0)(x1 - x2)(x1 - x3))
L2(x) = ((x - x0)(x - x1)(x - x3)) / ((x2 - x0)(x2 - x1)(x2 - x3))
L3(x) = ((x - x0)(x - x1)(x - x2)) / ((x3 - x0)(x3 - x1)(x3 - x2))

Now, we will plug in the values of x0, x1, x2, and x3:

L0(x) = ((x - 3)(x - 5)(x - 7)) / ((1 - 3)(1 - 5)(1 - 7))
L1(x) = ((x - 1)(x - 5)(x - 7)) / ((3 - 1)(3 - 5)(3 - 7))
L2(x) = ((x - 1)(x - 3)(x - 7)) / ((5 - 1)(5 - 3)(5 - 7))
L3(x) = ((x - 1)(x - 3)(x - 5)) / ((7 - 1)(7 - 3)(7 - 5))

Now, we will plug in the values of f(x0), f(x1), f(x2), and f(x3) into the Lagrange polynomial formula:

P(x) = L0(x) * 15 + L1(x) * 18 + L2(x) * 12 + L3(x) * 10

Finally, we will find the approximate temperature at 4 o'clock (x = 4):

P(4) = L0(4) * 15 + L1(4) * 18 + L2(4) * 12 + L3(4) * 10

P(4) = ((4 - 3)(4 - 5)(4 - 7)) / ((1 - 3)(1 - 5)(1 - 7)) * 15
     + ((4 - 1)(4 - 5)(4 - 7)) / ((3 - 1)(3 - 5)(3 - 7)) * 18
     + ((4 - 1)(4 - 3)(4 - 7)) / ((5 - 1)(5 - 3)(5 - 7)) * 12
     + ((4 - 1)(4 - 3)(4 - 5)) / ((7 - 1)(7 - 3)(7 - 5)) * 10

P(4) = (1 * (-1) * (-3)) / ((-2) * (-4) * (-6)) * 15
     + (3 * (-1) * (-3)) / ((2) * (-2) * (-4)) * 18
     + (3 * 1 * (-3)) / ((4) * (2) * (-2)) * 12
     + (3 * 1 * (-1)) / ((6) * (4) * (2)) * 10

P(4) = (3 / 48) * 15 + (9 / 16) * 18 + (-9 / 16) * 12 + (-3 / 48) * 10

P(4) = 0.9375 * 15 + 2.25 * 18 - 1.125 * 12 - 0.625 * 10

P(4) = 14.0625 + 40.5 - 13.5 - 6.25

P(4) â‰ˆ 34.8125

So, the approximate temperature at 4 o'clock in the afternoon is 34.8125 degrees Celsius.
